AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: Defendant convicted of aiding and abetting the transportation of undocumented aliens, whose vehicle was stopped and searched, and appellant in the case, requesting post-verdict discovery through juror depositions, owner of the truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.GARWOOD: Circuit Judge presiding over the appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper, driving the patrol car, did not testify to having reason to believe the vehicle came from the border, observed the truck and its occupants, had specialized experience and training
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper, testified without contradiction about recent apprehensions of illegal alien smugglers near the location, observed the truck and its passengers, had specialized experience and training, testified that the occupants were scrambling around trying to hide after he shined his flashlight into the truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron: Agents who jointly conducted the field investigation, observed the suspicious vehicle, and had reason to suspect the presence of illegal aliens in Garcia's vehicle based on various factors including the occupants' appearance and behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce: Namesake of a test regarding stops near the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.TATE: Circuit Judge dissenting in the appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron as b: Involved in stopping a pickup truck with a heavily loaded camper attachment on an Interstate Highway in Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pena-Cantu: Reference in a legal case regarding factors supporting the reasonableness of a stop
